sections.name: Halfling Head Chef
Chef's Menu
sections.text: A halfling head chef crafts exquisite dishes that tantalize the taste buds. Delights like honeyblossom pudding (honey, cream, and flower petals), stuffed burrow rolls (meat and vegetables wrapped in flaky pastry), sunberry glazed roast (meat marinated in sunberry sauce), and root medley gratin (layers of root vegetables and cheese) showcase their prowess.
Renowned for their culinary expertise, halfling head chefs navigate the complex world of high cuisine with flavorful creations and fiery tempers.

sections.name: Halfling
Halfling Communities
sections.text: Beyond their own towns and caravans, many halflings settle within the cities of humans and other ancestries. They find niches for themselves, often working as servants and restaurant staff. Halflings especially thrive in metropolises where people of many backgrounds pass through. They often lament that the environment isn't built for them, and need to practice climbing shelves or carry tools to operate high door latches and the like..

sections.name: Illicit Imports
sections.text:
Wherever there's a commodity that people want, there are always those willing to procure it and smuggle it in. Examples include: 
* Rare technologies from Alkenstar and Numeria.
* Exotic flora and fauna for private collection.
* Magical secrets from the Arcanamirium in Absalom or knowledge of the Mana Wastes from Nex.
* Narcotics.
* People, especially oppressed people being brought to safety.

sections.name: Kitchen Weaponry
sections.text: Halflings love objects that can serve multiple practical purposes, especially if their purpose includes eating. Few objects can be used for more activities than a frying pan, and many halflings relish telling others all the uses they have found for their pans if asked.
Despite their small stature, a halfling can prove to be a mighty foe if you find yourself on the wrong side of their frying pan.

traits.name: Halfling
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the halfling ancestry. These small people are friendly wanderers considered to be lucky. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by halflings. A weapon with this trait is created and used by halflings.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

interaction_abilities.name: Culinary Specialist
interaction_abilities.text: For encounters involving cooking and taste, the head chef is a 7th-level challenge.

interaction_abilities.name: Keen Eyes
interaction_abilities.text: The halfling gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the Seek action to find hidden or undetected creatures within 30 feet of them. Whenever the halfling targets a creature that is concealed or hidden from them, reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one.

automatic_abilities.name: Dash of Spice
automatic_abilities.trigger: The head chef is targeted with a melee attack by an adjacent attacker they can see
automatic_abilities.effect: The head chef uses Spice Mix against the attacker.

traits.name: Fatal
traits.text: The fatal trait includes a die size. On a critical hit, the weapon’s damage die increases to that die size instead of the normal die size, and the weapon adds one additional damage die of the listed size.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Backstabber
traits.text: When you hit an off-guard creature, this weapon deals 1 precision damage in addition to its normal damage. The precision damage increases to 2 if the weapon is a _+3 weapon_.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon’s damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon’s normal damage dice doesn’t change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Nonlethal
traits.text: Attacks with this weapon are nonlethal, and are used to knock creatures unconscious instead of kill them. You can use a nonlethal weapon to make a lethal attack with a –2 circumstance penalty.

traits.name: Unarmed
traits.text: An unarmed attack uses your body rather than a manufactured weapon. An unarmed attack isn’t a weapon, though has a weapon group and might have weapon traits. An unarmed attack can’t be Disarmed. It also doesn’t take up a hand, though a fist or other grasping appendage generally works like a free-hand weapon.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Backstabber
traits.text: When you hit an off-guard creature, this weapon deals 1 precision damage in addition to its normal damage. The precision damage increases to 2 if the weapon is a _+3 weapon_.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon’s damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon’s normal damage dice doesn’t change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Thrown
traits.text: You can throw this weapon as a ranged attack; it is a ranged weapon when thrown. You add your Strength modifier to damage as you would for a melee weapon. When this trait appears on a melee weapon, it also includes the range increment. Ranged weapons with this trait use the range increment in the weapon’s Range entry.

ability.name: Angry Rant

traits.name: Auditory
traits.text: Auditory actions and effects rely on sound. An action with the auditory trait can be successfully performed only if the creature using the action can speak or otherwise produce the required sounds. A spell or effect with the auditory trait has its effect only if the target can hear it. This applies only to sound-based parts of the effect, as determined by the GM. This is different from a sonic effect, which still affects targets who can’t hear it (such as deaf targets) as long as the effect itself makes sound.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Linguistic
traits.text: An effect with this trait depends on language comprehension. A linguistic effect that targets a creature works only if the target understands the language you are using.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

ability.effect:
The chef shouts a flurry of insults and criticisms at either an ally or enemy within 30 feet with the following effects:  
 **Ally** The chef's assistant is shaken by the barrage of criticism but is determined to work faster and harder. The target becomes quickened for 1 round but is also frightened 1. They can use the extra action to Interact, Step, or Stride, or as part of an action or activity to prepare, cook, or serve food.  
 **Enemy** The target must succeed a DC 18 Will save or take 1d6 mental damage and become frightened 1 (or 2d6 mental damage and frightened 2 on a critical failure).

ability.name: Spice Mix
ability.text: The head chef throws a mixture of irritating spices into an adjacent creature's eyes, causing the creature to be dazzled until it Interacts to clear its vision.
